verses.text: 1 "JESUS_END"O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.
2 "JESUS_END"I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother's house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
3 "JESUS_END"His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.
4 "JESUS_END"I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.

5 "JESUS_END"Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.

6 "JESUS_END"Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.
7 "JESUS_END"Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-8/" title="Song of Solomon 8:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
9 "JESUS_END"If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
10 "JESUS_END"I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
11 "JESUS_END"Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
12 "JESUS_END"My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
13 "JESUS_END"Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-8-14/" title="Song of Solomon 8:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14  "JESUS_END"Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
